PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Obviously , from the viewpoint of hole mobility , PzNDTDTBO is more suitable ( higher than 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) for the application as photovoltaic donor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| higher than 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 |

The "Property Value" entity in the paragraph is "higher than 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1". It is a measure of hole mobility, which is a property of a material that indicates how quickly positive charge can move through it. In this case, the value is being used to compare the suitability of PzNDTDTBO as a photovoltaic donor material in perovskite solar cells (PSCs).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| higher than 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 |

In the revised paragraph, the only entity that clearly refers to a "Value of material property" is "higher than 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1". This is a measure of hole mobility, which is a property of a material that indicates how quickly positive charge can move through it. The other entities in the paragraph, such as "PzNDTDTBO" and "photovoltaic donor materials in PSCs", do not refer to material properties and are not included in the table.
